founded.note: Founded in 1990 in Cambridge, MA. Merged with Incentives Research Inc. (founded 1983) in 1995.

offices.note: US offices only: Boston, Chicago, New York, San Francisco, Washington DC

specialties.note: Economic consulting firm focusing on strategy, analytics, M&A, risk, and due diligence with emphasis on litigation and regulatory work

industries.note: Primary industries: Financial Services, Energy, Healthcare, Technology, Telecommunications

compensation.ug.base.note: Research Analyst positions for 2026 start at $97,908 in New York. Used rounded figure.

compensation.mba.base.note: Associate positions range $188k-$220k depending on degree (MBA vs PhD). Used midpoint estimate.

recruiting.process.note: Half-day first round with case exercise, full-day super day with multiple interviewers

recruiting.timeline.note: Fall on-campus recruiting, winter second rounds, decisions within 1-2 weeks

career_path.note: Titles extracted from careers page navigation

travel.note: Consultants below Principal level travel infrequently, mostly office-based

work_hours.note: Typically 40-50 hours/week with occasional spikes. Better work-life balance than traditional strategy consulting.

byu.pipeline.note: Only 2 current BYU alumni (0 Marriott) suggests alumni_only pipeline—need to network with existing alumni

gaps.reason: No reliable data found for Research Analyst bonus
No reliable data found for Research Analyst signing bonus

Management Consulted page exists but redirects to other firms—likely paywall or access issue. Set to null.

notes: The Brattle Group is an economic consulting boutique founded in 1990, specializing in litigation support and regulatory economics. Pre-populated CSV data covered all LinkedIn and BYU fields. Firm website and careers page provided company information. Compensation data from Glassdoor and Levels.fyi. Interview process details from multiple sources. Very limited BYU presence with only 2 current alumni and 0 Marriott alumni, suggesting students will need to hustle and network strategically.
